newsitem.title: CHINA: Microsoft Corp to launch Office 97 in China.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft Corp to launch Office 97 in China.

text.p: Microsoft Corp will this month introduce a simplified Chinese character version of its Office 97 software package for sale in China, a company official said on Tuesday.
The U.S. software giant released a complex Chinese character version, for use in Taiwan and Hong Kong, last month.
Office 97 includes a suite of software applications, including the word processing application Word, spreadsheet Excel, graphics application Power Point and database application Access.

"This is a significant release for us," said Mark Anderson, director of retail desktop marketing for Microsoft (China) Co Ltd. "It's the first time we've had fully Chinese versions of all these programs."
Office 97 will retail for around 5,490 yuan with Access and 4,490 yuan without the database application, slightly below the prices for the same products in the United States, Anderson said.
Microsoft would officially launch Office 97 on May 12 in Beijing, May 14 in Shanghai and May 15 in Guangzhou, he said.
Anderson said he expected healthy sales of Office 97 in China, but declined to give estimates.
Another Microsoft official said sales of the software could be hurt by the widespread availability of pirated copies of the English and complex-character Chinese versions of the software.
Microsoft sold eight million Office 97 application licences between January 16 and April 17, Anderson said.
